titleStmt.title: George W. Anderson vs. J. C. Mitchell. Commitment

bibl.title: George W. Anderson vs. J. C. Mitchell. Commitment.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.
Territory of Washington, County of King, ss.
In the Justice's Court, Seattle Precinct, King County, W. T., before John F. Miller, J. P.
Territory of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. George W. Anderson Defendant
To J. C. Mitchell Chief of Police Seattle King County and the keeper of the jail of said King County
WHEREAS, at a Justice's Court held at my office, in said county for the trial of George W. Anderson for the offense crime hereinafter stated, the said George W. Anderson was charged with convicted of having, on the 30th day of September 1889, in said county, committed the crime of being a fugitive from Justice from the City of Portland State of Oregon and in the progress of the examination upon conviction the said Court did adjudge and determine that said there was probable cause to charge defendant Geo. W. Anderson with the crime of being a fugitive from Justice and he should be held pay a fine of a reasonable length of time for the presence of the officials from Portland, to wit at 6 oclock P.M. October 3, 1889. dollars, and dollars costand stand committed in default days or until the same be paid: and whereas, the said of bonds fixed in the issue of Fifteen Hundred (1500) dollars has made default in the payment of the same Therefore, you, the said Chief of Police are hereby commanded in the name of the United Stated forthwith to convery and deliver the said George W. Anderson to the said kepper; and, you the said keeper, are hereby commanded to receive the said George W Anderson, into your custody in said jail, and him there keep until October 3 1889 at 6 o'clock P.M at hard labor for the space of days unless said bond fine and costs be sooner furnished paid or he shall thence be discharged by due course of law. Dated this 2nd day of October 1889 John F. Miller Justice of the Peace.

Commitment. Territory of Washington vs. George W. Anderson
Filed 2nd day of October A. D. 1889 John F. Miller Justice of the Peace. Seattle Printing & Stationary Co., 211 SENECA St.
